title: Yet Another GPA Problem
statement: Munnazzar cries a lot about his GPA. He stops crying if his GPA is at least m; otherwise, he continues crying. Every semester, his GPA increases by 1. If his current GPA is n, determine after how many semesters he will stop crying.
input: The first line contains an integer T — the number of test cases (1 ≤ T ≤ 1000). Each of the next T lines contains two space-separated integers n and m (0 ≤ n, m ≤ 600), representing the current GPA and the minimum GPA Munnazzar wishes to have.
output: For each test case, print a single integer — the number of semesters after which Munnazzar will stop crying.
